intro: Parietaria lusitanica subsp. chersonensis, commonly known as the Chersonese wall-rocket, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes stinging nettles, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils, often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it is often used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh environments, contributing to its ecological significance in its native range.
